tools.title: API Client Creation Guidelines [Java Quarkus]
tools.description: Comprehensive guidelines for creating standardized API clients in Java Quarkus projects. Covers auto-detection of base package structure, proper directory organization with backends folder structure, implementation of REST client interfaces with JAX-RS annotations, wrapper classes for error handling and null safety, DTO models with Jackson JSON mapping, OIDC authentication setup for service-to-service communication, required Maven dependencies (REST client, OIDC filter, Jackson, Lombok), standardized naming conventions for classes and packages, configuration management with environment variables, best practices and documentation standards.

prompts.title: Create API Client with Naming Conventions
prompts.description: Generates a complete API client following both API client creation guidelines and mandatory naming conventions. Always use both naming_conventions_guidelines and api_client_creation_guidelines tools before generating code.

content.text:
You must create an API client for a Java Quarkus project. MANDATORY STEPS:

1. FIRST: Call the 'naming_conventions_guidelines' tool to understand the bilingual naming conventions (English for programming terms, Portuguese for business terms)
2. SECOND: Call the 'api_client_creation_guidelines' tool to understand the API client structure and requirements
3. THIRD: Generate code that follows BOTH sets of guidelines

When generating:
- Use Portuguese for business terms (e.g., 'ecommerce' â†’ 'EcommerceService')
- Use English for technical terms (Repository, Service, Client)
- Follow the DTO field naming rules (business fields in Portuguese)
- Apply the API client structure patterns

Please specify:
- Service name (use Portuguese for business domains)
- Base URL of the API
- Any specific endpoints or entities needed
